message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.MM, cs.NE 

The paper focuses on 3D human action recognition using skeleton data and proposes a new skeleton image representation to be used as input of Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs). This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the Computer Vision (cs.CV) sub-category. Additionally, the proposed approach involves encoding temporal dynamics using different temporal scales, which suggests that the paper may also belong to the Machine Learning (cs.LG) and Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI) sub-categories. The use of CNNs also suggests that the paper may belong to the Multimedia (cs.MM) sub-category. Finally, the paper involves experimental results demonstrating the effectiveness of the proposed representation, which suggests that the paper may also belong to the Neural and Evolutionary Computing (cs.NE) sub-category.
